title: Lectric’s new mid-drive folding ebike packs 100-mile range for $1999
content:
The Lectric XP 2.0 ebike was one of the best bargains we’ve tested, with a powerful motor, folding frame, and decent components for a thousand bucks. But while the XP 2.0 is a well-rounded ebike for people who just want to get from point A to B, Lectric’s newest ebike, the XPremium, seeks to bring value to a higher performance bracket. I haven’t had the chance to test ride the XPremium myself yet, but I did a double-take when I saw the specs and components on offer for $1,999 ($1,799 for the first few days). The bike packs three features that…

This story continues at The Next Web
description: The Lectric XPremium is one of few ebikes that offer a mid-drive motor, 1000 Wh of battery, and a torque sensor for less than $2,000
